attributes.action: Make the UK HSCT for MS and Autoimmune Diseases available via NHS to all MS
attributes.additional_details:
1) Sheffield HAVE to follow the strict trial criteria, otherwise it would not be a valid trial. But is it fair they are limiting themselves to partaking in a USA led trial?

2) Availability for HSCT in London, seems to be closed to Scottish people due to the devolved NHS. Is that fair?
attributes.background: I am an MS patient and I would like to be part of the existing research program available at the Shefield hospital, however the qualification criteria is very high and difficult to be accepted.

rejection.details:
The decision about which patients can take part in this study is not taken by the Government or Parliament. You can find out more here:

http://www.sth.nhs.uk/autologous-haematopoietic-stem-cell-transplantation-for-multiple-sclerosis/
